title: HSE Lead Job at Maventeq Systems Limited
content:
Maventeq Systems Limited - Our client, an Oil and Gas company in Nigeria is currently recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position(s): HSE Lead (Lagos)

Job Location: Lagos

The ideal candidate shall be responsible for the development, implementation, and monitoring of the project's Health, Safety, and Environment (HSE) Management System, ensuring compliance with all applicable regulations, standards, and Company's policies.

Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Development of the develop the Project CASHES Plan in compliance with Nigerian regulations
	Conduct HSE risk assessments and hazard identification for the entire project.
	Develop and implement comprehensive emergency response plans and define HSE training
	requirements for all personnel.
	Ensure that project plans and designs comply with all applicable HSE regulations and standards.
	Promote a strong safety culture among all project personnel and contractors through ongoing
	awareness programs and training.
	Conduct regular HSE audits and inspections of work sites, facilities, and operations.
	Investigate all HSE incidents, accidents, and near misses, and implementing corrective and preventive
	actions.
	Manage HSE training and awareness programs for all project personnel and ensure adherence to safety
	procedures.
	Ensure that environmental audits are conducted to confirm all areas are free from contamination and
	restoration targets have been met.


 Job Requirements


	BSc in Engineering or HSE-related field
	10+ years of HSE experience in oil/gas with 3+ years in Nigerian onshore projects
	Pipeline construction safety oversight
	Regulatory compliance (NMDPRA)
	NEBOSH International Diploma (mandatory)
	OSHA or IOSH Managing Safely
	HSE Level 3 (Nigeria)
	First Aid/HAZMAT certification
	Minimum 3 major pipeline projects
	Nigerian content compliance experience
	Fluent English & Computer literacy (MS Office, reporting tools)
	Strong documentation/reporting skills
	Willingness for full-time site presence


Method of Application

Candidates should send their CV to: careers@maventeqsystems.com

title: Document Control Lead Job at Maventeq Systems Limited
content:
Maventeq Systems Limited - Our client, an Oil and Gas company in Nigeria is currently recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position(s): Document Control Lead

Job Location: Lagos

The ideal candidate shall manage all project documentation, ensuring accuracy, traceability, and compliance.

 Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Implement robust document management systems and procedures for the systematic capture, storage,
	retrieval, and distribution of all project-related documentation from project inception.
	Define document numbering, revision control, and approval workflows.
	Develop the Master Document Register (MDR) for tracking deliverables.
	Manage the deliverable release schedule across all project phases, ensuring efficient document control
	and information management throughout the project lifecycle.
	Ensure all project documents are properly categorized, indexed, and archived for easy retrieval.
	Manage the transmittal of documents between all project stakeholders (Client, EPC Contractor, vendors,
	subcontractors).
	Consolidate as-built documentation for regulatory submission, compile test records (hydrotest reports,
	calibration certificates), and verify punch list completion and update final documentation.
	Ensure the final archiving of all project documentation, including as-built drawings, operation and
	maintenance manuals, and final reports, facilitating comprehensive project handover.


Job Requirements


	Bachelor's in Engineering, Information Management or related field
	Minimum 8 years in document control, with 5 years in oil/gas sector
	Mastery of document management systems (SharePoint, Aconex, Documentum, etc)
	Strong understanding of engineering document workflows and version control
	Experience with QA/QC documentation for oil & gas projects
	Experience on at least 2 major pipeline projects
	EDMS Administrator Certification (for relevant software)
	Nigerian Institute of Management (NIM) certification (advantageous)
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Advanced Excel mandatory)
	Strong reporting and analytical skills
	Knowledge of Nigerian Content Development requirements
	Fluency in English (written and spoken)


Method of Application

Candidates should send their CV to: careers@maventeqsystems.com

title: Project Control / Contract Lead Job at Maventeq Systems Limited
content:
Maventeq Systems Limited - Our client, an Oil and Gas company in Nigeria is currently recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position(s): Project Control / Contract Lead 

Job Location: Lagos

The ideal candidate shall be responsible for establishing, implementing, and continuously monitoring robust project control systems and managing contract compliance aspects for the PMT.

 Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Establishment, implementation, and continuous monitoring of robust project control systems
	encompassing scheduling, cost control, and progress measurement.
	Development and maintenance of a detailed integrated project schedule and work program, including
	identification of critical paths and baseline establishment.
	implementation and monitoring of project cost control systems, including budget adherence and initial
	expenditure tracking.
	Support the Project Manager in the overall management of project contracts, including client contracts,
	ensuring initial compliance and setting up administration protocols.
	Shall manage tender processes, including bid evaluations and contractor pre-qualification.
	Shall oversee contract administration, including variations, claims, and payment certifications.
	Continuous monitoring of project cost control systems, including expenditure tracking, forecasting, and
	variance analysis against the budget.
	Preparation and submission of regular, detailed project performance reports (e.g., daily, weekly,
	monthly) to the Client, providing clear insights into project status, progress, deviations, and proposed
	solutions.
	Monitor contract compliance for all subcontract agreements and vendor agreements, supporting
	dispute resolution and change management processes.
	Accurate measurement and verification of work progress across all engineering and construction
	activities, leading to the preparation and submission of progress invoices to the Client based on
	achieved milestones.


Job Requirements


	Bachelor's in Engineering, Quantity Surveying or Project Management
	Minimum 12 years in project controls, with 5 years in lead roles for EPC projects
	At least 3 completed pipeline projects
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Advanced Excel mandatory)
	Strong reporting and analytical skills
	Knowledge of Nigerian Content Development requirements
	Fluency in English (written and spoken)
	Experience working in Nigerian oil/gas sector preferred
	PMP Certified (advantageous)
	Certified Contract Manager (CCM) or equivalent (advantageous)
	Nigerian COREN registration (advantageous)


Method of Application

Candidates should send their CV to: careers@maventeqsystems.com

title: Technical Manager Job at Maventeq Systems Limited
content:

Job Position(s): Technical Manager

Job Location: Lagos 

The ideal candidate shall be responsible for technical assurance, quality control of all engineering deliverables, and providing technical support and guidance to the project team across all technical disciplines.

Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Conduct technical reviews and approvals of project specifications, drawings, and designs. Define
	document numbering, revision control, and approval workflows.
	Ensure compliance with API 5L, ASME B31.8 and other applicable industry standards

title: Procurement Lead Job at Maventeq Systems Limited
content:
Maventeq Systems Limited - Our client, an Oil and Gas company in Nigeria is currently recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position(s): Procurement Lead 

Job Location: Lagos

The ideal candidate shall be responsible for the development and implementation of the project

procurement strategy and plan, managing all procurement activities, and ensuring timely and costeffective acquisition of all required materials, equipment, and services for the project.

Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Development and implementation of the project procurement strategy and plan.
	Ensure compliance with Company's procurement policies and procedures and all relevant legal and
	ethical standards from the outset.
	Initiate vendor pre-qualification processes and manage all procurement activities, including tendering,
	bid evaluation, contract negotiation, and award.
	Establish procurement schedules aligned with project milestones
	Ensure timely and cost-effective acquisition of all materials, equipment, and services required for the
	project.
	Conduct bid evaluations and prepare recommendations for award and negotiate contracts with selected
	vendors
	Expediting and logistics management to ensure on-time delivery of long-lead items and critical materials
	to support the construction schedule.
	Coordinate material deliveries to match construction schedule and manage procurement variations and
	change orders
	Coordinate with engineering and construction teams to align procurement activities with project
	schedule and technical requirements.


Job Requirements


	12+ years of procurement experience with 5+ years in oil/gas EPC projects
	BSc/BEng in relevant engineering or management discipline
	Nigerian Local Content implementation
	Pipeline materials procurement background
	Expertise in EPC procurement strategy development, Vendor pre-qualification & Nigerian Content
	compliance
	Expertise in Contract negotiation, Materials expediting & logistics planning
	SAP/ERP procurement systems (advantageous)
	CIPS (Chartered Institute of Procurement)
	Nigerian Content Compliance certification
	Fluency in English (written and spoken)
	Experience working in Nigerian oil/gas sector preferred


Method of Application

Candidates should send their CV to: careers@maventeqsystems.com
